I believe in 'interdimensional' entities like gnomes, fairies, etc, but not how most people do. I don't think of them as spirits or magical entities, or as beings who came from some 'other world', they're from this world but in the folds and facets that we can't normally perceive.

Like, if you reached into your couch cushions and found a penny, that penny may as well have not existed to you until you found it, but you wouldn't go "oh, this penny must have come from another couch!"
no, it was in your couch. just in a place you don't use for couch things in your day-to-day.

Now picture the whole of the couch is reality itself, and the place you sit is the scope of normal human perception. these beings are responsible for the majority of paranormal encounters and high strangeness, including aliens, UFOs, and bigfoots.

>>33779600
Some further advice I can give. First, I would recommend that you look through the Traditionalist school authors. They are very reliable people and if you understand their works you will have a frame of reference to distinguish sound knowledge on these subjects from bad info. Evola is also included, particularly his spiritual books, even though the wikipedia editors have excluded him for some reason. Not all of the stuff you see on kundalini will be the best, because there was nothing like the flow of information back then that we have now. The principles are perennial, however, and will help guide you.
Second, about energy. The terminology is kind of ambiguous and can have slightly different connotations, but generally, energy, chi and prana are loosely equivalent. For a breakdown on energy (specifically chi), you can check out Damo Mitchell's Intro to Daoist Nei Gong. He has a section on this that you may find useful. I think that's a book I can probably mention on /x/ with clear conscience.
As to the difference between energy-as-such and kundalini energy in particular, it comes down to this: the energetic level is a kind of subtler level of the physical (or the physical is a denser level of the energetic if you prefer). This energetic level is kind of superimposed on top of your body and you rely on it for a lot of your normal functioning. This applies to all people. Kundalini energy is a special energy - it is the transcendent force, and it has a purpose and a goal which, once awakened, it pursues without pause, even if you suddenly have second thoughts. This transcendent force aims to help you overcome your conditioned existence, purge your energy system (which involves a lot of emotional/trauma releasing since those are stored as energy, and it also involves kriyas), and finally, when the process is complete and it fully develops your 7th chakra, you receive a strong connection to the divine, and enlightenment.

>Are you a polymath?
Ummm...... Maybe. Okay yes I am a polymath (also commonly referred to as a "Renaissance man") I just prefer not to always talk about it or want to sound airheaded (because I know it sounds airheaded). I've been told I'm a polymath by tons of people throughout my life initially to my surprise but I think I just get bored quickly and need to keep things fresh (or become depressed).

I pick up roughly 3 new hobbies every year, start a new collection every few years. I finished college 2 years quicker than average while still partying 3-4 weeks/night and powerlifting everyday, then decided to get a master's in the following year. I end up leading almost every friend group I've ever been in. I'm working in a fairly rigorous field (while also leaving another rigorous field) while also trying to start a business in an emerging field that barely exists right now. The only field I've always had trouble with is language but I still know 3 (English, decent Italian, and shitty Spanish) and have always believed being able to read people's subtle body language is much more important for communication than what they say.

Personally I think it keeps things fresh to pick up new things as much as you can and the more fields one indulges in, the more you can blend them into something new or something from a totally unrelated field would help significantly with whatever dilemma is faced in another.

But none of that matters if one either isn't happy, isn't able to love others and themselves, or can't share their interest and knowledge with someone else.

It's not hard. If you look for demons, you'll find them.

Every day, especially at night before bed, put your energy and intent into thoughts about a demon coming to meet you in a lucid dream. don't be specific about anything, don't use any names. Before you lay down to sleep, say to yourself aloud, "a demon will come to speak to me tonight".

That's it. The more you put your energy into doing that, the closer you'll get. You don't need anything else but you should have your questions prepared. You should also keep in mind that you're strangers meeting in a weird place. You might become something more, you might not. Be respectful and polite. Don't ask for things.

If you really want the, "magick" experience, you need to create
your own names and sigils. Make a sigil for it, you can think of it
like finding a spirit guide. Give that sigil (not the demon) a name.
Do not share the sigil or the name with anyone.

There's nothing to worry about with all of this, just be polite and
maintain composure. Do not in any way insult them when they come.
You should be sure you really want this though. This isn't like amazon grimoires or spooky short stories. This will work and if
that's something that might threaten your sanity or remove you
from some kind of weird fantasy, you shouldn't be fucking around
with any of it in my opinion.

I should mention, I did this and it took months. I didn't give up, I had questions that I needed answers to. I put that energy and that will into the desire to meet them and in my mind i was willing to accept that it might take years or decades. it took several months. nothing changed or progressed, it just happened. a lot was said and i was very honest about my own experience. from the beginning i said that i believed him to be a subconscious projection and he convinced me to just experience it. i asked for proof in a respectful way and he wasn't offended at all, he understood why. he told me some things that were very specific. names, really exact things that would happen. years later, it all happened exactly as he said. there's something in the mind though, it's almost like it never happened. it did, this is 100% the truth with no added frills, but it seems detached and unreal to me. at times i'll randomly sort of snap out of a daze and realize that those beings, whatever they really are, are very real and it's been proven to me. it's hard to accept, but i don't really know way. it feels like something hardwired into us.

if you go through with this, don't waste time like i did when it happens. just go with it, have your questions prepared, give them room to ask you questions. take a moment to look around, feel your hands, breathe the air, notice the colors, the textures, the smell of the air.

posts.com:
Belief is the only requirement, and the realness of your scene is what makes it believable. To be able to imagine something so real that you deeply believe it is more real than what is going on around you in 3D space is how you change the world to your desire. It's as simple as that. If you are having a problem realizing your dreams, that problem is somwhere in this very simple process.

Either you haven't given your mind enough time to accept the new reality, or your scene is not real enough in general, or you are not going deep enough to make your scene more real than the world around you during visualization.

Some people are more naturally inclined to believing the scene in their head, in hypnosis these people are "easily suggestible", these people can believe greater things and have greater potential to have their desires fulfilled in physical reality. Others have a harder time lending belief to the reality of their own imagination, this can be overcome in a number of ways; the various experts of hypnosis have developed countless methods to increase the suggestiblity of their subjects. I would recommend anyone who struggles to believe their scene to investigate these techniques.

Practice with simple things like simple shapes.
Try to just imagine a square or a ball in your mind and make it bigger and smaller and change its shape or texture or material or color.
Imagine a rubber ball. Now change it to glass. Now change it to plastic. Now change it to a balloon. Now change it to fur.
Change the lighting.
Change the environment it is in.
Put a ball inside a glass box.
Make it bounce around inside the glass box.
Simple stuff like that.
Imagine yourself explaining others how to visualize.
There is not really anything to it, you don't have to force it, just imagine it. Sometimes there's not so much detail to begin with, sometimes there is a lot of detail to begin with.
Change the story and add new things to it.
Imagine an empty room for example.
In the room there is a ball.
It is rolling around in a circle.
In the middle of the circle is a garden gnome.
He smokes a bubble-pipe.
His hat is red.
He looks at you and winks and says to you that you got it.
Then he disappears in a cloud of purple smoke.
You become aware of the rolling ball again.
Now make something new up.

Try writing down what you want to imagine.
Ask yourself: what are the basic elements of it?
Ask yourself: what detail can I add that would make it more vivid?
Are you imagining yourself sitting down, standing up, walking around?
What does it smell like?
What does it sound like?
Just describe it in your imagination as you go along, detail after detail.
You don't need a complete image to start with, and you don't need to hold all of the details all at once, as long as you know they are there because you described them.
Play with it and fill out the details, and when you do, the picture becomes clearer and clearer and more and more easy to imagine.

if you write it down and read it to yourself it makes it very easy to imagine. when you see the sentence: rubber ball bouncing around a room. you immediately imagine it without thinking about it. Just narrate a story in your head.

>>33797550
>Do you think scripting will help?
It helps me a lot.
Lots of things bubble to the surface when I begin writing.
Sometimes I just write without having a set goal for what I want to write, and just write down what comes naturally to me. I scribble down what comes to mind without thinking about what I'm writing, even if it's nonsense and or silly.
Then I read it and question myself, on what I can improve upon. It gives me a perspective on what my current mindset is.
I take everything into consideration, and then I consciously write something in the areas that I think I can improve upon.
Like for example I might have some sad and bad thoughts about specific things. I might have issues with specific things.
What I do then is that I write into that aspect and explore it further, and try to go into the depths of what's behind it.
At that point I can begin to write about how I can change it, and then I begin writing the manifestations that I want to see in detail, and then I imagine and pray and manifest into it until it's no longer an issue.
Sometimes I don't need to write anything but if I feel like I'm stuck it can help a lot, because it gives me something tangible to do and focus on.
It usually brings up some layers that I never consciously thought about and often I get the feeling that something 'clicks' and that 'I get it now' and I can begin to move forward because I have something to work with.

>>33797704
The Ascendant Ruler is the planet that rules the rising sign, in your case Saturn. It marks out an area of special interest for your life. In your case, your placement of special interest is depressing your ascendant ruler.
In astrology there is this thing called an aspect. There are various types of aspects. Co-presence is when two planets share a house, sextile is when they're within a range of three houses, square is when they're within a range of four houses, trine is a range of five and opposition is a range of seven. Any planets that are in houses right next to each other or six houses away, however, are in aversion. Aversion is when planets do not see and interact with each other. This is bad for your Saturn, because Saturn is in a house ruled by Mars but cannot connect with it to receive support. Although fsr in your chart the engine you're using is saying there's an opposition between Mars and Saturn instead of aversion, which seems like nonsense to me. Both in Placidus and Whole Sign, your planets should be six houses away.

Despite his elusive nature, Klubbis was greatly beloved by those who had experienced his comforting presence at night. Many people hoped to one day be lucky enough to have Klubbis choose them as his sleepover partner, and would leave out treats and toys in the hopes of attracting his attention.

In the end, Klubbis remained a mysterious and beloved figure, bringing comfort and good luck to all those he visited at night.

When thus prepared, science can be brought to aid it; the sight itself may be rendered more subtle, the nerves more acute, the spirit more alive and outward, and the element itself—the air, the space—may be made, by certain secrets of the higher chemistry, more palpable and clear. And this, too, is not magic, as the credulous call it; as I have so often said before, magic (or science that violates Nature) exists not: it is but the science by which Nature can be controlled.”

— Edward Bulwer-Lytton,Zanoni

>It is fit that we who endeavour to rise to an elevation so sublime, should study first to leave behind carnal affections, the frailty of the senses, the passions that belong to matter; secondly, to learn by what means we may ascend to the climax of pure intellect, united with the powers above, without which never can we gain the lore of secret things, nor the magic that effects true wonders.

—Trithemius of Spanheim,On Secret Things and Secret Spirits

for each person there is a unique path, but it always involves some form of suffering because the first stage of enlightenment is graduating from third to fourth density. for me, it required failing at my desired career overseas and becoming isolated while enduring a whole gamut of strife. by the time your low enough and your ego has been reduced to rubble, you will either make the choice of taking your own life or extricating oneself from "me" and realizing "we" and comprehending synchronicity and the bilateral nature of the mind.

then its time to move from 4th into 5th. this means learning and understanding love. people usually get stuck here thinking they figured it all out but remain quite emotional and capricious as a result. eventually you'll reach another satori upon witnessing and comprehending mistakes and attachments involving love and misconceived ideas of love.

then its 5th into 6th. here you will comprehend wisdom, and by that i mean knowing when to use love and how to use it appropriately. again, after screwing up x amount of times you'll discover the give and take nature of love and the reciprocal flux of this force emanating from God. Here you will finally comprehend that all is mind.

6th density so far is a stage in strengthening and understanding the power of mind and knowing when and how to apply ones mind. life is in ones control and at this stage it's learning how to balance and raise others. it's the stepping stone to a higher dimension, which I believe is only achievable after leaving this material plane on planet Earth.


These are the stages of "enlightenment". Take your time, don't care about being high. It's about learning and improving. Enjoy each stage. All have their novel, memorable moments. most importantly, don't give up and do your best and dont be hard on yourself. enjoy your life and give your love to the best of your ability and don't burn yourself out either.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: >Along with Vicharasangraham (Self-Enquiry), Nan Yar (Who am I?) constitutes the first set of instructions in the Master’s own words. These two are the only prosepieces among Bhagavan’s Works. They clearly set forth the central teaching that the direct path to liberation is Self-enquiry. The particular mode in which the enquiry is to be made is lucidly set forth in Nan Yar. The mind consists of thoughts. The ‘I’ thought is the first to arise in the mind. When the enquiry ‘ Who am I?’ is persistently pursued, all other thoughts get destroyed, and finally the ‘I’ thought itself vanishes leaving the supreme non-dual Self alone. The false identification of the Self with the phenomena of non-self such as the body and mind thus ends, and there is illumination, Sakshatkara. The process of enquiry of course, is not an easy one. As one enquires ‘Who am I?’, other thoughts will arise; but as these arise, one should not yield to them by following them , on the contrary, one should ask ‘To whom do they arise ?’ In order to do this, one has to be extremely vigilant. Through constant enquiry one should make the mind stay in its source, without allowing it to wander away and get lost in the mazes of thought created by itself. All other disciplines such as breath-control and meditation on the forms of God should be regarded as auxiliary practices. They are useful in so far as they help the mind to become quiescent and one-pointed.

posts.name: The Nobody
posts.com:
>>33771353
>why is the whole thing tied to feeling dread?
Emotions are created by the brain in response to physical sensations, and they are modulated by the context in which they are felt. Dread however, is only in small part an emotion. It is largely a pain reflex and an attention modifier. This is what makes dread so difficult to deal with, it amplifies its own emotional context.

As for why sleep paralysis is comes with dread, it's because of the physical discomfort. You are restrained, your heart is stressed, and your breathing is strained. Through proper attention and awareness all of these physical discomforts can be lessened / ignored. The dread can dissipate, and it can even become a thing of the past. These were my experiences.

posts.name: The Nobody

>>33771502
>what you mean by "attention modifier"?
That's the most important part. Dread restricts one's attention and generally produces paranoid thoughts as a consequence. Simply calming down is often not enough to counteract the demand dread puts on one's attention. There is a mastery of focus that comes in to play as well.

I have had experiences that I would like to understand.

I heard from a tv show that sleep paralysis happens when you wake up from a nightmare.

I have experienced waking up from a nightmare with sleep paralysis and a sense of a threatening presence, perhaps a looming darkness or dark figures and a feeling of fear. That all went away when I had asserted my will and managed to move, breaking out of that state.

However, I also experienced something else when I was a child.

Sometimes while trying to fall asleep, shadowy figures dragged me to a flaming pit blocking the doorway to my room and down the "fire hole" (as I called it as a child) into a nightmare. I had nightmares multiple times a week, and this is how many of them began, like a frame tale.

I was scared, suffering, and losing sleep. That may be how my insomnia started. I could run to my parents to tell them and get a hug, but I still had to escape from these nightmares that I occasionally got dragged into by figures similar to the presence or presences I sensed during sleep paralysis.

I started lucid dreaming as defense against all the nightmares, and sometimes I could control the dream. Usually after going lucid, I wake up, because I realized that I was dreaming.

Sometimes I would get stuck in a nightmare and have fight to get out. One time I was stuck in like Escher Battlezone 2 (from like Win 95) but all the lines were burning red, and there were dark figures that looked like the ones that dragged me into that nightmare. I thought they wanted to keep me there and hurt me. So I imagined summoning a tank, (I was like 10 so a tank seemed like the most powerful option even in the non-euclidian geometey of the landscape, plus it's mobile.) So i blasted the presences (honestly they looked like straight up Grays except red and black instead of gray.)

I have varied dreams now and few nightmares, and sometimes I lucid dream. I am also schizoaffective but that was not until I turned 29. Mabye irrelevant.

The entity is something you manifest in your mind because you are afraid, what is happening is that you wake up but your body is still asleep so you can't move and because you cannot move you become scared. in this in-between sleep state where you are alert but your body is sleeping, you can have waking dreams.
There is no entity sitting on your chest, you're seeing it a dream, while you are awake.

It is easy to become afraid when you can't move like you expect to be able to, but once you start feeling fear, the manifestations of your dream will simply compound that feeling as they would with any other feeling.

hope this helps!

posts.com:
SP victim here.
The shadow creatures seldom show up. Sometimes they are there, but hidden. How do I know? They float objects, or place objects near my bed.
When they show up, they feel like automatons. Like a hologram movie. They don't react to yelling, and they are transparent to punch and kicks. Sometimes they have a face, other times they are like a thick smoke without shape. Color is the absolute darkest black.

The entire phenomenon follows a pattern:
> Bad breathing, blocked nose (low oxygen to the brain)
> Sleeping looking upwards (avoid: spirits are atracted by this)
> Coming out of REM phase faster than usual, that is, just after a dream (fucked up circadian cycles can cause this)
> A tremor inside the ear
> Room is exactly like real one but in black and white
> Cannot move much, if at all
> Low conscience level, enough to not to feel too much fear

How to get out:
Option a) Call Jesus. Works 100% of the times.
Option b) Find what part of the body you can control, move it, and amplify it until the movement awakens you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
My first experience with sleep paralysis lasted only 10 seconds. I surmise it was induced by over sleep since I decided to nap around 11am or so after a full night's sleep.
What happened was that I could not move obviously, but I noticed two big black hands covering my face. I attempted to yell/scream/talk/move to no avail. I could only feel the internal struggle of trying to get something out and during this experience, I heard this fucker breathing and how it was breathing. It was pretty much chuckling- it seemed to have found pleasure in the hold it had on me.
Several years later I had a couple of sleep paralysis episodes but they were brought on by taking sleeping pills and only lasted 10 seconds or so. Those were easy to get out of. My whole body was buzzing and I could not tell if I was falling off the bed or not, but was able to snap out of it by saying, "OK, I'll count to three and get out of this", and it worked.
My regret is not calling on Jesus Christ during the first experience, which I know was a demon attack.
It's easy for the enemy to get ahold of you. All you have to do to fight, is use the Holy Spirit, Jesus and God to discern these things in your head that are polluting your thoughts. To discern is to swiftly cut through the bullshit.
You're welcome.

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

The theology (supernatural phenomena) justifies belief in core values (proper conduct in the real world), but to take particular elements of the theology and literalize them seems disingenuous. A snake in the garden, as a symbolic concept, provides meaning; but a literal talking snake is just a plot point. To see modern content about scripture ask questions like “what kind of fruit did Eve eat?” misses the point of what the fruit is supposed to represent.

I think I have some sort of telepathy-like ability. Allow me to explain:

All my life (moreso when I was younger, but it still happens occasionally) I've had times where I dream of something, and later, whatever I dream of will happen. It's usually unimportant things, to be fair. One that sticks out was the time I had a dream of my family and I riding around looking at Christmas lights in Texas (I was about 12yo). Another one I remember from about that same point in my life was a dream I had of myself walking into the laundry closet at my house and sitting on top of the dryer. I remember that one because as soon as I realized what was happening, I tried to purposefully change the course of things just to see if I could, only to wind up doing things exactly as they had happened in my dream, like my mind had parceled out only the necessary info in order to prevent me from changing things, until the end when I realized that I hadn't changed anything, if that makes sense.

>Inb4 "it's deja vu"

I can't make anyone believe me, but it's not. I've experienced regular deja vu in the past and this is different. When something I dreamed about is about to happen, it comes back to me that I had dreamed about it, not in the same way deja vu hits you. Besides, there's been times that I remembered the dream immediately upon waking. The Christmas light one I mentioned was one of them. I specifically remember waking up the next morning thinking "I wonder when that's gonna happen". When I have one of these types of dreams, I just know. It just feels different.

On a completely separate note, I've noticed that sometimes I can do something akin to reading minds. But not like in the movies. It's more like, a thought or feeling will occur to me that feels somewhat alien, but still like it originated in my own head. Like it's my own thought but not my own thought at the same time, if that makes sense. Example: several years back, I was driving somewhere and began to wonder if it would be possible to run a red light by drifting over into the lanes on the right of a 4-way intersection. Like, if I was approaching a red light at a 4-way, could I swerve over into the perpendicular lanes on my right-hand side and drive straight through the light, dodging any potential traffic cameras. It was weird to me, because I don't usually think like that when I'm driving. Not gonna claim I'm the safest driver, but I usually don't do anything that specifically stupid. But the thought stuck with me, every single time I got in my truck for like, a week. And then, I was at a 4-way intersection, and I saw someone do it. Only time in my life I've ever seen anyone do that, right around the time that I was thinking about it.

There was another time I think I read someone's mind who was in the same car as me, kinda guessed what they were going to say, as well as the underlying attitude they were going to say it with, but I can't remember the specifics right now.

>Inb4 "that's just confirmation bias"

Ok, sure. Cool.

Has anyone else experienced anything like this before? Anyone know if I can strengthen or hone this ability? I really feel like if I tried, I could control it, but I have never tried and honestly don't have a clue where to start.

If you want a teacher whose not just going to separate you from your neetbux you'll probably want to figure out what exactly you mean by "energy work".
There are any number of different historical traditions with systems that could fit the bill, but only you'll know what lights your fire. Once you know what suits you and you've done some research into it you'll be better able to figure out where to look for a teacher. And better able to judge whether or not they're peddling crap.
If you're interested particularly in Kundalini and Indian style work you couldn't go wrong with reading the three books listed under Hindu Mysticism in the OP.
Best advice would be to keep an open mind but retain skepticism when treading these waters, don't get so invested into some strip mall guru you can't see the writing on the wall.

O crystal heart! I the Serpent clasp Thee; I drive home mine head into the central core of Thee, O God my beloved.
Even as on the resounding wind-swept heights of Mitylene some god-like woman casts aside the lyre, and with her locks aflame as an aureole, plunges into the wet heart of the creation, so I, O Lord my God!
There is a beauty unspeakable in this heart of corruption, where the flowers are aflame.
Ah me! but the thirst of Thy joy parches up this throat, so that I cannot sing.
I will make me a little boat of my tongue, and explore the unknown rivers. It may be that the everlasting salt may turn to sweetness, and that my life may be no longer athirst.
O ye that drink of the brine of your desire, ye are nigh to madness! Your torture increaseth as ye drink, yet still ye drink. Come up through the creeks to the fresh water; I shall be waiting for you with my kisses.
As the bezoar-stone that is found in the belly of the cow, so is my lover among lovers.
O honey boy! Bring me Thy cool limbs hither! Let us sit awhile in the orchard, until the sun go down! Let us feast on the cool grass! Bring wine, ye slaves, that the cheeks of my boy may flush red.
In the garden of immortal kisses, O thou brilliant One, shine forth! Make Thy mouth an opium-poppy, that one kiss is the key to the infinite sleep and lucid, the sleep of Shi-loh-am.

~Opening Ch IV, Liber 65

So in Viridarium, Ars Philtron, and Psalter of Cain there's a bunch of stuff suggestive of the Mass. I'm writing up a "minimally heretical gnostic creed" rooted in Miaphystie theology and the Armenian Creed, then taking the bugfuck insane modern Gnostic Catholic creeds and walking them back as hard as I can to the aforementioned baseline will still containing actually relevant Gnostic data without needlessly multiplying our theology with complex systems of Neoplatonic Aeonics.

Then I have a few snippets of prayer that have come to me over the years.

Then is a brief writup of the forms of the Witches Supper: Misrule, Ganachakra/Tsok, The Red/Houzel Feast, Gnostic Mass proper, Initiatory Mass (see ThROA), Feasts for/of the Dead, and then incidental feasts.

Then I pull out every quote I can find dealing with Midnight's Table in the Sabbatic Corpus, a concept that's cognate with the Baetylus but appears to IMPLY a degree of dealing with the Mass. One CS member has teased for years that "Midnight's Table" is a complete body of teaching but so far all we have is a couple quotes - in some sense this is for me to "I'll make my OWN midnight's table with belladonna wine and hookers".

Then I'm going to pull out the sections of Viridarium et al that deal with like the loaves and some general thoughts on droplet empowerment, Our Mushroom, Banewort Oils, and THEN I can start actually writing some rituals.

I'm legit hooked from this alone. Very good.

I don't want to sound like a broken record or a cliche, but that is super based. You have a good foundation for this.
>Gnostic Catholic creeds
I imagine you've already read about this, but the works of the early Ecclesia Gnostica Catholica are very enlightening. Especially the stuff from Gerard Encausse aka Papus. Reading how he took elements from classical Gnosticism and the Catholic Church is a creative fuel like nothing else.
>without needlessly multiplying our theology
Yeah, the most simple stuff tends to "work" better.
>THEN I can start actually writing some rituals
The more "pre-fab" ones that you can incorporate the better. Especially if you're going for a EGC type set up. You have freedom to alter things, but the stuff that can be kept intact makes it so much easier. Maybe I'm a weirdo for this, but I've read extensively from the more "fringe" Catholic missales and it really does get the noggin joggin. Especially the Mozarabic Rite. Or the original Tridentine. Saint Basil also has a nice aesthetic and all of those can be adapted to suit a less Orthodox bent.

>>33796461
The Bible was not writen to be read as a sole work of literature, but to be understood within a liturgical, ritual context. The Nephilim are not explained because they are part of the larger near-eastern cultural heirloom, and already present in most other nations as semi-divine kings or spirits of the evil dead. The Bible doesn't explain them because they are already known to the original readers, and simply makes a clarification about their origins and role. This doesn't means the Bible is false, but that a modern approach to it won't work, specially when one deals with the Old Testament that in many parts presupposes the reader as familiar with its ancient context or at least with a religious tradition aware of it.

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

I attempted physical transmutation a few years ago, as I was curious whether it might work. However, I discontinued my efforts after a few weeks, as it caused severe inflammation and pieces of dead skin falling off in a particular area. Not only was the pain becoming unbearable, but I realised what I was doing was highly dangerous, as it was becoming difficult to even urinate. After discontinuing my magick, which consisted of daily energy work in a deep trance, the symptoms subsided in just a day.

My conclusions are that it's far more efficient to change physical things by physical means, and spiritual things by spiritual means. Not only that, but it's dangerous to attempt to remove body parts with magick; it's no different from convincing those parts of your body to destroy themselves, with no guarantee of actually getting the results you want. In my experience, physical surgery is both safer and much less painful in comparison. However, based on other results I got such as a sudden spurt of breast growth, I do think it can be useful for healing.

You posted here a while ago and clarified that you're not interested in physically transitioning, nor in changing spiritually. Perhaps it could be useful for you to try to understand why you think you want to be a biological woman, and find (other) positive ways for you to fulfil the underlying needs.

>>33792328
>crisis of faith
I haven't even read LL, and I still feel like that sometimes. Earlier today, someone asked me to pray for him, and it took me a few minutes to gather my resolve to request Lilith's assistance. I managed to stay calm by recalling that I've never felt malice from her, and that she only helped me get what I wanted.

What I've realised lately is that what I fear isn't really her, but rather things within myself that I'm afraid of as I don't understand them, then project outwards onto her. And as those projections don't appear to be wrong, I come to fear her instead of myself. But then I see her expressing those things that I couldn't accept about myself in such positive ways instead, and I begin to realise it was my fears that caused those sides of me to come out in the wrong ways in the past. When it's coming from her in such a calm and dignified manner, she makes it look so natural, and I realise I can be like that too.

What I thought to be so monstrous and feared, turned out to be womanhood; in the most unapologetic sense, unfiltered by society's expectations. It's embarrassing to admit that I got those things mixed up, and it's honestly a lot to take in. But as I come to understand her, and myself, the fear fades away.
Of course, men nor women are inherently good or bad. But people can get so lost as they misunderstand each other, and themselves in turn. If they feel ashamed of things that are perfectly natural, it saddens my heart. It's useful to know what's socially acceptable, but people mustn't lose themselves.

I don't know if that relates at all to the fear in your own heart, but I feel like I understand it in a way. As people idealise others from their own limited perspective, they're in fact rejecting the parts they don't understand; then if those misunderstandings are revealed, that can be very shocking or even frightening.

Dear,
Thank you about your kind letter about the monster I spawned all those years ago. I have no idea who owns it, where its present incarnations rests, nor who profits from its sales to this day. Certainly not I, nor any of my former colleagues who worked on the game for about three years. One could almost say that it “died” under the same circumstances that gave it birth. One week it was #1 best selling game in the US, the following week Inscape folded and the game was buried. Conspiracy? I have no idea. I pulled the sequel Cult as I had no wish to return to the blood arena that is software publishing. No wish to return to that haunted city of Lost Angels. I feared that Cult had a dangerous side effect and the actions of Aum, The Solar Temple, and the Branch Davidians stayed my hand. I think it was a wise move. The world is too fucked up without me adding to it. I went back to writing children’s books and being an artist. But your letter is moving. I read it to my wife Mandy and she was pleased that somebody out there remembered it and enjoyed it. Drowned God was such a mammoth venture and it remains for me under the category of misunderstood. It’s beginnings were humble. A notebook that remained from 1983 when I penned the antique forgery The Diary of a Plagiarist and sold it (12 volumes) in the Cowgate, Edinburgh. A film of that episode was commissioned by Channel 4 but was once again thwarted. Ten years later I resurrected the basic premise for Drowned God. Time Warner bought the rights. The game was commissioned before the X-Files, suddenly what had seemed a left field minority interest was propelled into $3 million dollar flagship for Inscape. This was a pity, because it meant that much of what I had written was censored. Even the last realm of the game, Chokmah, is merely a 1/10 of what was made.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772879
The military temples and underground bunkers were reserved for Cult. Where they are now I have no idea. I was locked out of my own game. Indeed, so much was cut that I fear the story made no sense. Perhaps there is a fitting justice to all of this. My partners in the construction of Drowned God were seduced by promises of great wealth. The English producer made secret deals with Time Warner for a bigger portion of the pot. Film deals, 5 book deals with Eranta, a record deal, etc. A paid for and promised engine to realise a personal route through the game, devised on the numerology of the Bequest Globe, failed to materialise. For the nine personality types there were nine pathways. Even the running order of the Realms was changed, with Binah starting the game, where the original game had begun with Chesed, the Mayan realm. My original storyteller in the game, the Relic Hunter (Richard Horne) was cut and only makes a brief appearance in Din. It was through this character that all loose ends were tied and explained. When the game came out it was critically hailed and panned at the same time. Loved or loathed, my favorite quote from Playboy(?) who said it made The Twilight Zone seem like Pee Wee’s Big Day Out, the game languished for a month with sales of 100,000 before disappearing.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772886
I have never made a penny in royalties. But I still feel proud of my monster. Your letter reminds me of the same thrill that I had devising it. Recently I was approached by Rockstar (Grand Theft Auto: Vice City) to consider making Cult. My feelings for the moment remain the same, as I have said. Perhaps later… For now this is enough. Write back and perhaps we can continue our discussion. My sister lives in New York state in a place called Goshen. Mandy and I sometimes see my publisher in NY so who knows… A glass of absinthe for me. And we’ll talk it up a storm, Best wishes to you, Harry Horse “What were we if our souls have lived before; We teem as sand grains to our present shore, Yet all may be dust from some opening door!” – RH Orion, 1846
>(1st of 2)
>https://archive.org/details/richard-horne-letters/

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Letter 2 - 10th august 2005

Dear,
Your letter arrived this morning and awakened in me ideas that had for several years lain dormant. For the topographical inspiration for DG came from a dream and last night my dreams were disturbed by low visions of military temples and unholy crypts, shifting sands over barren deserts and forgotten decaying landscapes. Your letter added to the feeling that something in me had shifted and despite my resolution that this umbrageous legacy should remain closed, sealed, something in your perceptions about the horrific endings of Kether and Malchut was resurrected...
Perhaps my dreams are informed by my current nocturnal readings.
The Shadow Over Innsmouth by HP Lovecraft, a tale of mingled terror and fascination set in the decaying seaport towns of New England; fishy hybrids and ancient secrets locked in extraterrestrial vaults under the spume of troubled waters. All those abandoned wharves and warehouses crumbling into the sea. Crooked eaves and terror soaked inhabitants scuttling to preserve the secret from prying outsiders, all grist for the mill for my own febrile imagination, the foundations for which our nightmares are built upon. Blame myself for making that ground fertile, for allowing the seeds of horror to find dark soils worthy for those’ mares to take hold, but wether I read Mailer, Henry Miller or that mad mage the crafty one, still am I troubled. Like the ten year old boy I once was I enjoy scaring myself to sleep, though the waking moments at 3.am promise hat filled cranial machinations. I am a cosmanaut venturing into the unknown inner spaces of the unconcious. I bring back scattered fragments of the dream and try to weave some semblance of coherance.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772895
The first dream in 1981 informed the making of 'Diary of A Plaguarist', the 18th century manuscript describing the fall of Atlantis and the subsequent cyphers of the secret, complete with the rival factions who vie for control. In those days my knowledge of the arcane and occult was minimal. The work was simply to acquire a sum from the pompous booksellers in the capital. I was poor and the income I generated as an artist was minimal. Finding blank papers in a drawer and soaking them in tea produced a pleasing antiquarian effect. My copperplate handwriting ( enclosed sample, only a copy I am afraid) and emulation of illustrations of that time provided decent subterfuge. I produced 11 chapters or manuscripts, thusly decorated. Each copy bound and sewn. Orange juice to culture a mould on the covers. Dust from the fireplace scattered on those mouldering covers. Greased endpapers mothballed and tinctured, even the smell was authentic. Let me explain that my real name is Richard Horne ( though for reasons I shall not enter into here I prefer to be recognised by my nom de plume) and for the purposes of disgusing the true authorship of these manuscripts I simply spelt that name backwards- hence Dracir Enroh, dated 1846.

The contents of the Diary were rambling and nonsensical. I was merely after the prize. Selling the diaries as they were produced very fortnight to a dealer called Armstrong. He was taken with the look of the books and offered me the sum of £ 50 for each one( a pittance, but fortune for me) on the understanding that I bring him all 12 in due time. He believed as I had told him that the manuscripts belonged to my father and were kept in a drawer of his bureau, and that it was necessary for me, so as not to arouse suspicion, that I remove them one by one, with a period of weeks between each theft. Colluding with me in this way I was given ample time to concoct the latest version.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772902
At first the Diaries were concerned with the Blavatskian ramblings of the Theosopshists. As you have so rightly noted, the ramblings of the Relic Hunter, much given to discourse upon Atlantean airships and manimals. After three volumes cyphered in this manner, replete with diagrams and maps of the citadel, pages filled with Sumerian cryptograms and number codes, German expressionist poetry copied from unread books on the subject, I began to exhaust my small library and turned instead to filling the pages with diagrams from a nuclear fission handbook from a power station, engineering blueprints for aeroplanes and other delights into the handbook of a modern Nostradamus. Joyfull as this was to the japester in me, it was my final undoing. I had been carefull to select a bookdealer who dealt in bric-a-brac, rather than an authentic expert in antiquarian books. The inclusion of these groundbreaking discoveries whetted the appetite of Armstrong. This unpublished manuscript made the work of HG Wells seem like the blind musing of a pulp writer. Here, afterall, were the rudimentary and accurate sketches for a fission, nearly a hundred years before the discovery by modern science. Here, the dates of the two great wars and the descriptions of the vessels that would carry those dread payloads. Turn a page and see the blueprints for the aeroplane, the tank, the motor car. And unlinke Nostradamus, the names of the players. Not Hister but Hitler. Armstrong the dealer went to his fortune. He took my forgeries to a publisher.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772906
I believe in synchronicity, not coincidence. The 23 Skidoo Principle. Schroedinger's Cat. Call it what you will. I should tell you that I was already a published author and illustrator in the employ of Canongate Publishers. Indeed I took some of the manuscripts there to be photocopied. I was working on drawings for 'Jekyll and Hyde' (pub. Canongate 1985) and would mix up these and the secretive workings of my efforts to preserve something of my labours - for posterity. Armstrong took my seven manuscripts to an expert called Dr.Black (I kid you not) who in turn took them to Christie's, the internationally held experts in the field of antiques - and rare manuscripts etc.

Now here is the strange part. Unknown to me there really was a writer called Richard Horne who was working in 1846. His most famous book is called Orion, a verse poem recalling the slaughter of the Sons of God by Diana the Huntress in Merope. He was born in 1803 and his last book written in 1884 was called 'Sithron the Star Stricken', subtitled, a 12th century manuscript discovered under the ruin of Solomon's Temple, translated from the ancient Arabic manuscript by Salem Ben Uzair (really Richard Horne). Orion was published in 1846. The expert was convinced that this was one of his forgeries of japes. Thrilled, Armstrong took my manuscripts to the first publisher he could find... Canongate. I was discovered ofcourse and prosecution was threatened. A deal was struck in the musty backroom of the shop. I was to provide the rest of the manuscripts at a reduced cost. It served me right I suppose. I only wrote up to the 11th Diary of A Plaguarist and then escaped to France.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33772915
Sithron begins thus :
'I pray the lord Christ's pardon, having found,
Something perhaps I should not, underground.
But human good and ill the mind alone can bond
If it shall change the arms, force, Art of War.
Extremes will come and end the bloody jar
And my space wandering ghost find its absolving star,
For days must dawn when men will tire of strife
And touch the trembling secret of this life
And catch a glimpse beyond with different wonders rife...'

Now I must return to my daily work though even writing this letter has whetted my appetite for further discussions. I am intrigued by your ideas. More...More..more. I can tell you that you would not have been dissatisfied with Chokma. Certain recordings by remote viewers on those underground labyrinths under White Sands and the Four Corner Area of New Mexico, Colorado, Utah and Arizona hold secrets that we cannot concieve of. Experiments in flesh, on animal and man. Who's now the nutter? Military temples and desert venom... The pigman is a Nostradamus quatrain. Perhaps it is a description of the gas masked biological warrior or else it is one of those Cayce inspired animals...transmuted flesh..the hybrid that my dear collegue Prof.Hapke from the University of Edinburgh spoke of in the taverns of the Cowgate. His theory, that could clear a room in minutes, was that the pig was a relative of ours, a mutant result of an ancient nuclear war described in the Maharrabata (Vishnus and Vhiminis, an Indian epic describing a war between the gods that vapourised elephants and armies into dust, flying chariots that were controlled by the pilot's mind alone) and that the food taboo associated with certain religions was an unconcious memory of this fact.

My salutations to you,
Harry

P.S. Mandy says that I should tell you that 20 years ago I tried to buy back those manuscripts from Armstrong.
He would not sell them at any price.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33769773
I've already done so several times, but here you go.

Me and my friend drove to an isolated spot near a creek to do some drinking. We feel like we are being watched when we pull up and park. A few minutes later, all we are doing is watching behind us (parked backwards to the woodline) and I see a pale white form standing out from the darkness. It's skin was like dry old dusty leather with varicose veins that are blue. I freak the fuck out and tell my friend to drive away. As we drive away me and him see the damn thing run across the road. It was incredibly fast and I saw it just barely long enough to make out its form. It was tall, had skinny arms and legs and a unusually small but round head (compared to its body). We drive away a few miles and it fucking follows us down the road, it kept up with the car.

We park at a lit parking lot that had cameras over it. It pops up a few hundred feet in front of us near some bushes and an unlit road. We take some pictures but they are of a quite shit quality for a multitude of reasons. Picrel is the one picture we got that shows something, a pair of eyes.

After an hour we decide to drive to the center of town to a 24/7 gas station for water and human contact (it was 2AM at this point). We exit the parking lot but are stopped at a light before the main road. To my right is a Grove of trees. Friend says he saw something moving over there.

My eyes adjust and I see the upper portion of its head peaking from behind a tree. It was staring directly at me. It eyes seemed huge but it was in fact it's eye sockets which absorb almost all incoming light. I couldn't look away and after a minute of probably the most horrifying, traumatic experiance of my life, I tell my friend to drive away. The moment I could no linger sustain eye contact I broke down into tears for about 30 seconds.

Words cannot fully describe how terrifying and evil these things are, and I had the luxury of encountering it from the safety of a car!

I block out the real terrors. I can't bring myself to remember them and I never write them down despite writing down all my dreams.

The scary ones I remember are the invisible ones that attack me. They triggered major traumatic events in my life. They came and held me down, many invisible hands, pushing. They wanted to put me under the bed. I googled it afterwards and in some cultures they are called Kaboose, or 'the pressure'. These nightmares were terrifying, it was as vivid and ordinary as real life until the pressure took hold of me. I have also had a booming voice say my name, audibly, in what felt like waking life, though it must have been hypnogogic trance.

I was attacked in a dream again a couple weeks ago. Here are my notes for that dream

>He was tall and lean. Dark. I told him I was sorry and that I didn't mean any harm. I told him I wanted the best for him. I was looking out for him. His hand reached out to me. I had a feeling his gesture was violent, but I caught his hand and pressed it to my chest lovingly as I told him I just wanted the best for him. I wanted him to not . . . his hand was pressing closer and I felt as though his hand was rising up my chest to my neck, and I almost leaned into it. My eyes became blurry. I stared directly at him as I told him repeatedly I just wanted to know you; I just wanted to know you . . . as I looked at him I saw his entire being was nothing but a black blur, a smudge, a smoke, pure black . . . I just wanted to know you . . .
>I woke up with my hand at my chest and a strange feeling at my throat. Did I feel something behind me? Touching me? I was terrified that I was not alone. I remembered the Hawaiian cords that travel from the crown and imagined something there, at my cord, at the crown of my skull. My right ear was flat to my pillow. I heard a sound like buzzing, like a breath, loud, like my ear was cupped by a seashell or like my something was breathing heavily close to me.

>>33769286
grew up in canada, and we had a channel called YTV, I think it's still around. But anyway, there was this show back in the mid 90s, with these 3 puppets, I think they were white and they each had different colored hair that was made from sparkly tassels or something. Anyway, there was a red one which I think was the leader, a blue one and a green one. For some reason I think they were a "band" or something. Only thing I can remember is them kinda bouncing around on a puppet stage thingy, with their hair flying all around. Very hazy memories of them, I've tried finding the show over the last 2 decades but I cannot find anything relating to it.
So, onto the good stuff. Around 1994 to about 1997 at the old house I lived in as a young kid, I would have these nightmares every night of these three. I am 30 now and can still remember some of them vividly. These dreams always felt very real and I always dreaded going to bed every night because I knew they would come.
They always started off with me in bed waking up at some point in the middle of the night after my mom had gone to sleep. I had a night light on and always had my radio on with the oldies channel on, so old boomer music from the 50's and 60's would be playing. So, I would awake in my racecar bed, which was facing the bedroom door and the only light would be from my night light, so pretty dim. I could see the hallway, the white walls were always a sorta nighttime blue hue and then blackness at the end of the hallway where the bathroom was with the stairs to the main floor off to the left. I would always be awake for a few moments and then I would hear voices coming from down stairs, like whispering voices, like mischievous they were up to no good. They would be talking coming to get me. Then I would hear running up the stairs and the three "puppets" from the show would come running from around the corner of the stairs into the hallway into my room to get me. I would wake up every time. Cont.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33773161
I would wake up every time they were about to kill me. Here's the kicker, they looked absolutely nothing like the puppets from the show. They were always adult sized in height and medium builds, not too lanky or bulky. Their hair was always really long and poofy, almost like the hair styles you'd see on glam metal band members. They always had paper white skin and these paper white jump suits with stripes going across from their mid arms and chest. Their hair and stripes on their jump suits were were the same colors from the actual puppets on the show, so Red, Blue and Green. I remember the eyes on each of them were black with tiny white pupils that glowed and they had sinister grins with razor sharp teeth. They fucking horrifying! Legit getting shivers typing this out, remembering these thing's and the setting. I can still remember it like it were yesterday, the smell of my room, the droning sound of oldies music playing and these freaks making a mad dash up the stairs and into my room surrounding me in my racecar bed, getting ready to eat me with those sharp teeth.

I always hate these threads because I put a lot into what I write and no one replies but whatever.

Ill keep them short and sweet then. These are the ones that really stick out.

One dream turned nightmare has me running first person through a nice neighborhood on a windy spring day. However all of these houses were right next to each other, only divided by their fences with a bit of yard grass in between.
I turn around and look to see a tornado forming above me, I make a quick decision to break into someones home to seek shelter.
Inside it was scary quiet, as if it was me in a void. I hear the sound of someone snoring off in the distance. I close in and notice an elderly Chinese man dressed in an ornate, red Chinese robe. The kind a Kung-fu grandmaster would wear. He looked to be napping sitting down on his couch, the living room was surrounded by authentic martial arts weaponry and ancient artifacts. I hear something crunch under my foot and before I could realize what it was I hear a deafening scream coming from the old man. Think those baby plants from Harry Potter. It all happened so fast, but in a matter of one second he gets up from his couch draws a bladed chained looking weapon and everything turns to black. I assume I died before I even hit the ground.

Another was where I was a king of some ancient Sumerian style city-state, surrounded by absurdly tall guard walls. About the size of a 15 story building.
After I take a tour of my city and met with all of my subjects ( I could tell I was a beloved leader that was trusted and respected, though I could also tell that some of the elderly and mature people seemed uneasy about something else going on)
I finally demanded my royal guard, after their many efforts to divert my attention, that I wanted to see what was beyond those walls.
They finally conceded, and led me to one of the doors opening to a winding staircase.
I reach the top and am heart struck by what I see.
Surrounded on all sides, approximately 3 miles(5 kilometers) of desolate no mans land separated us and an extremely hellish mountain range that encompasses our city full circle. The mountains were covered in dark black ash cloud with intermittent thunder illuminating the silhouette of jagged peaks and red hot hell.
They seemed to close in. I couldn't quite tell, but it seemed as it was creeping closer and closer.
I finally realized then what the walls were for.
I looked at my one guard accompanying me.
He looked defeated, almost as if he wanted to cry. We said nothing, but understood. There was nothing that could be done. We were all going to perish.

I had a dream-vision a while back where I was apparently a Soviet conscript in WWII.
I'm laying in a slight depression, surrounded by corpses, lots and lots of corpses.
It's raining shells.
There's some blown out ruins ahead of me at about 400 meters distance, and I can see what are apparently the enemy being silhouetted against the sky through the windows and cracks of the buildings.
It's cold and drizzling, the sky is grey, and the ground I'm laying on is muddy.
There's apparently an advance by them because then they're right up on top of me, < 20 meters. That's when I realize that I'm not the only one laying in that pile still returning firing.
There's movement as some of my guys jump up and are scurrying forward the best they can.
I'm real low on cartridges, so I call out, "Hey, anyone there, you got any ammo?!"
I recognize the face of the man that runs up to me, a personal friend, though at the time I can't quite place him.
He hands me eight cartridges, five on a stripper and three loose. I notice he's not carrying a rifle.
"Here comrade, make them count!"

the scariest dream i ever had was when i was 7. it was about blue aliens, it happened in 3 parts
part 1, i see a news broadcast talking about how blue aliens are planning on abducting people tonight
part 2, my mom and dad are sitting on the porch talking about the upcoming alien abduction, i eavesdrop on their conversation
part 3, i wake up in the middle of the night. i'm paranoid about aliens so i go to tell my dad that i can't sleep. i'm walking down the narrow hallway to my parents bedroom. their bedroom door swings open, and my grandma (who didn't live with us) is standing in the threshold holding a basket of laundry. i can basically only see her silhouette. i ask her what she's doing. she doesn't say anything, her eyes light up neon blue. she starts to pursue me down the hall. my mom emerges from the bedroom also with glowing blue eyes. they chase me, i try to run but they catch me easily. they shed their human disguises and reveal their true alien forms, they look like greys but they're a deep blue cor. they put something like a brown plastic shopping bag over my head and start dragging me. they drag me through my sisters bedroom where she's sleeping. they take me out of her window and we're beamed up to their ship. that's when i woke up.
other than that the only monster i can recall ever dreaming about is bigfoot

posts.com:
Back in the year 2012 I had an incredibly vivid nightmare about fighting machines.
I was somewhere I understood to be Northern California, near the coast. I was separated from my friends and family and fighting alongside a group of strangers. We had no uniforms, and there were women and unarmed people in our group. We looked like homeless people with guns.
Suddenly this huge, dark cloud of whirling flying machines comes over the horizon. It came up and over one of those big, steep hills like they have in San Francisco. Countless machines actually darkening the area with their shadows. They looked like the man hacks from Half Life 2.
There was so much fear and panic.
We started retreating inside this shitty looking building to hide. The windows were all boarded up and there were objects like mattresses and tables places against the walls and windows to make them thicker.
We understood somehow that the machines could see through walls and this was our crude effort to hide as deep inside the house as possible and avoid being seen. Walls bolstered by fucking mattresses and cardboard and whatever was there to sort of "muffle" their vision.
We put the women closest to center of the house and posted up with rifles behind over. I remember being aware of them coming by the windows and looking for us.
As the cloud of machines attacked, different parts of it split off and spread out down the alleyways and streets. It was like they all had one mind and each rotor thing was just a single digit of this gigantic organism. You could hear screaming off in the distance when they bore down on a particular house and discovered someone.
It wasn't until around 2020ish that I saw that Chinese footage of a drone swarms and recognized it from the dream.

when i lived in a somewhat rural area that was expanding with new developments over time I saw/heard/experienced a lot of weird shit. And other people have too. Since I don't live there anymore i'll dox myself for the sake of storytelling. place is called Cumberland Beach in Ontario, immediately across the lake from an Ojibwe reservation and was Ojibwe land a long time ago. I'll start with my stories then move on to one I heard from someone I know (story pertains to her childhood friend)

>be me about 4 years ago now
>like going /out/ because nothing else to do in tiny community, no car
>huge development in backyard, gated, in construction at the time. Built on farmland.
>cars lining surrounding streets because 3/4 of parking lot had to be not built due to uncovering of graves during excavation
>le indian burial ground
>parking lot was on the back wall of the development, over the fence from neighbors backyard
>on the other side of development was long wooded road, was about 2 miles long
>one side of road had woods belonging to gun club
>other side has patch of woods belonging to no one (was eventually bought by development)
>road leads to other patch of woods, wetlands, unsuitable for building so popular spot for hikers and such
>walking back from going hiking, is twilight
>walking down the long road with the woods
>footsteps double
>stop
>hear nothing
>start walking
>footsteps double again
>stop again
>hear loud panting right in my ear
>whip around
>nothing
>start speedwalking
>speedwalking doubles
>sprint
>hear panting, now more distant, until i'm ~100m from a house
>get back without incident

DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Not all lions made supplements are made the same.

Some are made from the lions mane fruiting body (the part of the mushroom in picrel from >>33784846)

Some are made from "myceliated rice", which means rice that theyve let lions mane colonize. This is much cheaper to produce.

The fruits and the mycelium contain different beneficial chemicals. The people who sell the myceliated rice shit would tell you they have identical benefits, or that theirs is better. I call bullshit though. Make sure your supplements specify that they use the fruits or fruiting body.

I spent quite some times in similar places. I work as a museologist in germany and during WWII, many museums and galleries hid their artifacts and artworks in those or similar places so they wouldn´t get destroyed in the bombings.

First place I worked at, found a "new" network of tunnels in the 2010s and we spend a lot of time in there finding loads of the museums old inventory.

Nothing spooky, tho.

Don´t get me wrong, I don´t doubt that there might be some weird things happening in those in other places, but my own experiences have been insanely cool, but tame in the creepy/paranormal sense.

In the heart of Stockholm, Sweden, there lies a mysterious place known as "Drömmarnas Brunn" or "The Well of Dreams." It is said that this place can be accessed through a sewer lid in the city, leading down into a vast network of tunnels and chambers that stretch for miles beneath the surface. As one enters the Well of Dreams, they are greeted by a warning: "You have found the well of dreams but you will never find the Tunnel City." This cryptic message is said to hint at the existence of a hidden community of outcasts who live within the tunnels, choosing to remain hidden from the outside world. Many stories and legends surround the Well of Dreams and the Tunnel City, with some claiming that it is a place of magic and mystery, while others view it as a dangerous and lawless place to be avoided at all costs. Whatever the truth may be, one thing is certain: the secrets of the Well of Dreams and the Tunnel City remain shrouded in mystery, waiting to be uncovered by those brave enough to venture into the unknown.

>>33785191
I used to work for Con Edison back in the 90s before I changed to sanitation. I had to change jobs because it was too fucking freaky down there.

New York City has hundreds, maybe even thousands of miles of tunnels. Some of which go back all the to the fucking 1800s.

We found all kinds of shit down there, bodies, animals, a fucking bear once. Entire fucking homeless cities with dozens of people living there.

I've seen and heard the weirdest shit you couldn't imagine. I'll never go back down into the maintenance tunnels again after this one time.

I was working on a route under the lower east side, right outside of downtown. It has one of the highest rates of shit breaking going on down there because all the businesses and huge homes and condos. They put such a tremendous strain on the system, there are constant fires and outages.

We were really deep in the old tunnels where the walls are sandstone bricks from the early 1900s, everything is brass and the wires are covered in thick heavy coating, almost like cardboard. At the time, all the main wires had not been replaced, yet.

I was pulling down a junction box with my buddy, and we both heard this fucking low pitch guttural sound, like a cat throwing up, but long like a growl. So we stop and look, cause there are feral animals down there, and the rats are fucking huge. They're a serious threat.

We turn and look down the corridor into the darkness, and there's this fucking creature standing there at the turn. Maybe 4 feet tall, extremely thin and gangly looking. Its eyes were bright orange in my headlamp. It was standing there in the corner just watching us, pacing back and forth and growling.

My friend and I fucking ran out of there so god damn fast I tore my ankle slipping up the catwalk into the main tunnel. Two months later I transferred to sanitation with DSNY. Never fucking looked back.

I'm 61 now, about to retire. I'm planning to move out of New York into the rural area of Pennsylvania.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.

•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

posts.name: Poncho

>>33795565
This isnt the best advice but how I did it. Use the white book for definitions and keep on doing reads on div over and over and over. Start with 3 cards, but after awhile look up spreads and make your own. Get criticism in exchange for reads, no feedback no read. If a querant cant give feedback due to the nature if the query its alright. Keep doing this over and over until you either memorize the cards and reversals or you start to interprete the cards with your own definitions.

While doing that, or after. Always think about the card positioning in the spread but card juxtoposition and multiple shapes and lines within the spread. Usually the cards have the answers but we fail to see what they're saying. Do that until it all clicks.

I am of the OPINION that when starting out you shouldn't read books. The style that comes forth is your own style, not some other person. This is not a fact but my own retardation. This is probably the harder way to learn but it's the way I learned. Nothing worthwhile in life comes easy
